Course Description: AN INTRODUCTION TO ELECTRONIC DATA PROCESSING IN ACCOUNTING WITH EMPHASIS ON ACCOUNTING CONTROLS AND REPORTS FOR CORPORATE ACCOUNTS, PROPRIETORSHIP, AND PARTNERSHIPS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
AT THE END OF THE COURSE, STUDENTS WHO COMPLETED ALL ASSIGNMENTS AND PARTICIPATED IN CLASS AND GROUP DISCUSSIONS SHOULD BE ABLE TO:
•	DISCUSS THE CREATION OF A NEW COMPANY DATA FILE
•	DESCRIBE HOW TO SET-UP THE CHART OF ACCOUNTS
•	DESCRIBE THE CREATION OF CUSTOMER AND VENDOR LISTS.
•	DESCRIBE HOW TO ENTER TRANSACTIONS
•	DESCRIBE HOW TO PREPARE REPORTS
Textbook(s):
COMPUTER ACCOUNTING WITH QUICKBOOKS, 17TH EDITION. MCGRAW-HILLS,
ISBN 9781259183867
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
